text.p: Delphi Information Systems Inc said Monday that Denis Connaghan resigned as president and chief executive officer for personal reasons.
Delphi, which provides integrated business solutions to the personal and casualty insurance industry, said Connaghan will continue to serve as a director and consultant.
It was not immediately known who would replace Connaghan. The company could not be reached for comment.

"During Connaghan's tenure as president, Delphi has refocused its core business and solutions offerings to capitalize on new opportunities offered by changing distribution in the insurance industry," Yuval Almog, chairman, said in a statement. "He also put in place the company's current management team and was responsible for Delphi's recent private placements of $10.7 million."
